articles.title: Salesforce lays off 4,000 workers as AI agents replace customer support jobs
articles.summary: Salesforce CEO is laying off 4,000 customer support jobs and replacing them with AI. Marc Benioff says Salesforce‚Äôs AI system now handles half of all support interactions, cutting costs by 17% and eliminating thousands of roles. articles.title: XAI CFO Mike Liberatore Leaves Three Months After Taking Job
articles.summary: XAI Chief Financial Officer Mike Liberatore has left the company just a few months after taking the job, according to people familiar with the matter, creating a high-profile vacancy at Elon Musk‚Äôs artificial intelligence startup.

articles.title: Apple Plans AI-Powered Web Search Tool for Siri to Rival OpenAI, Perplexity
articles.summary: Apple Inc. is planning to launch its own artificial intelligence-powered web search tool next year, stepping up competition with OpenAI and Perplexity AI Inc.

articles.summary: Senator Mark Warner‚Äôs visit was classified and not intended to be publicized. It was to include a meeting with the head of the agency and a briefing on the agency‚Äôs use of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Shein pulls ad featuring accused killer Luigi Mangione
articles.summary: The image of Mangione seen on Shein was either generated by Artificial Intelligence or was photoshopped.

articles.title: xAI's finance chief steps down after a few months on job, WSJ reports
articles.summary: The finance chief of Elon Musk's xAI, Mike Liberatore, has left the artificial intelligence startup after just a few months on the job, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

articles.title: Subdued Decision in Google Antitrust Trial May Help Keep a Monopoly in Power
articles.summary: After a five-year legal showdown pitting the U.S. Department of Justice against Google, a federal judge concluded that the disruptive forces of artificial intelligence technology will have a better chance of hobbling an illegal monopoly than any restraints imposed by a court order.
